events.title: October Revolution in Russia
events.description: The Bolshevik Party, led by Vladimir Lenin, staged a coup d'Ã©tat against the provisional government in Petrograd, leading to the establishment of a communist government in Russia.
events.significance: It marked the beginning of Bolshevik control over Russia, leading to the creation of the Soviet Union and significant changes in global geopolitics.

events.title: Election of Franklin D. Roosevelt to Fourth Term as U.S. President
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt won the U.S. presidential election, becoming the only American president elected to four terms.
events.significance: His unprecedented fourth term during World War II helped shape U.S. leadership and policies during a critical period in modern history.

events.title: Woodrow Wilson Reelected as U.S. President
events.description: Incumbent President Woodrow Wilson was re-elected to a second term, defeating Charles Evans Hughes.
events.significance: Wilson's leadership during and after World War I had lasting impacts on American foreign and domestic policies.

events.title: Controversial U.S. Presidential Election
events.description: The U.S. presidential election between George W. Bush and Al Gore occurred, with results contested and ultimately decided by the Supreme Court.
events.significance: The decision impacted U.S. electoral processes and highlighted vulnerabilities in the voting system.
